intro: Hesperis robusta, commonly known as the robust wallflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Hesperis robusta thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
